title: "Lightning" slanted techno sans on firework box
content:
I have looked everywhere for this font or something similar. Have been told that it might be called 'Vaccu Bomb' which I cant find anywhere.

Any ideas for this font or something similar would be gratefully received. Thanks in advance for any advice

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lightning.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/typophile.com/files/lightning.jpg) | 32.86 KB |
author: tobo27

comments.content:
Is Techno Sans the font im looking for then or has my post just been categorized.

And if that is the name of the font, where can I get it.

Sorry newbie!!

Techno sans is just the category of font. Your thread title was probably changed because the original was too vague. I would suggest checking the techno sections at [dafont](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/www.dafont.com/).

- Lex

From the [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/typophile.com/forums/typeid/faq/) page:

[**The subject line of my thread has been changed.**](http://web.archive.org/forums/typeid/faq/#Q_10)  
There's two possible reasons for that.  
**One** | The name you gave to your thread was very vague so we changed it into something better defined. This makes it easier for our type IDers to keep track of the different threads.  
**Two** | Your sample has been identified. Your thread gets tagged and we include the name of the typeface(s) you were looking for and the name(s) of the person(s) who IDed it/them for you. That way we don't need to needlessly open threads to check if there's still need for our services.

See reason 1. ;^)
To further explain -- we have people that are specialised in certain types of types (pardon the pun), that's why I often add a classification in the thread title.

See [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=72008) regarding the book **[Metalheart](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/1584230894%3ftag=digitalthread00%26link_code=xm2%26camp=2025%26dev-t=0ANSEDX6J9YW0WPEQCG2)** by Andreas Lindholm (Brainreactor)
Unfortunately the CD that comes with the book only showcases some of Andreas Lindholm's work. The enigmatic vaccubomb does not seem to be there.
Too bad. Do you own it, Angel? The amazon description and the page 5 (table of content) from "inside the book" made me think of having this typeface inside in digital form.
Yes I do and I didn't see it on the CD. BTW, the myfonts forum has just posted another one of Andreas Lindholm's creations (Octane)... go and sort it out will you please!

Thanks Angel for the info, and the other, too :^D  
Done.
"Thanks for finding the font. Joe Shansky

If you are still around Dave... The folks at pixellogo.com do have the full collection of Andreas Lindholm fonts and will sell you Vaccu-Bomb Italic for $19. All you have to do is contact them first as it's not listed in their catalog.

[http://www.pixellogo.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114185437/http:/www.pixellogo.com/ "http://www.pixellogo.com/")
Thanks for all your help. I have contacted Pixelogo and made an enquiry about purchasing this font.
